review_title: Overall a great place to work
pros: Fantastic training, with ongoing training opportunities throughout career. Highly supportive and active service manager. Generous annual leave and plenty of opportunities for overtime. Generally flexible if time off needed with decent notice given. Fantastic service users and highly varied job. Friendly and supportive staff team.
cons: Poor pay which doesn't reflect individual responsibilities of staff at different services. One size doesn't fit all. Development plan in place but little incentive or support for employees wishing to take part. Often asked to partake in cover when you're off work - this can sometimes feel pressurised. Little information provided about benefits and how to access them. High staff turnover. High number of agency staff used.

pros: The residents are brilliant to work with. Most of the other staff are are really lovely to work with.
cons: Using alot of agency and you don't know who you work with.
